Posts.Content: Jul 24, 2012 11:08PM Abby20 wrote: I have been told also that I will need chemo and radiation also so it is a long way
Posts.Title: I am so scared Abby20 kathleen1966

Posts.Content: Aug 1, 2012 07:10PM Abby20 wrote: Dear Yellowfarmh, You are amazing! Congratulations for your recovery and wish you long happy and healthy life. I am doing my best to be positive! as many of the wonderful ladies in this club mentioned, the first stage is difficult. I am still waiting for the result of my MRI-guided biopsy. My exact dx is not clear yet. I am reading and hearing different opinions about mastectomy vs. lumpectomy, and still confused between my options. My surgeon is in favor of mastectomy but when I consulted with an expert oncologist she said there is no medical benefit of removing the whole breast. So far, all I know is that I have 1cm tumor in my left breast. I want to take an informed decision but the information out there is confusing. I don't have a personal preference; I just want to go for the most effective treatment ... I guess this is all what we all hope for  cheers,
Posts.Title: I am so scared Abby20 kathleen1966

Posts.Content: Aug 2, 2012 09:31PM Abby20 wrote: Dear wonderful friends, My biopsy result came negative  so now they only found one IDC 1cm in left breast, the doctor said I am a good candidate for lumpectomy, I will have an appointment with the surgeon in Monday to decide about the surgery. I am much relieved now
Posts.Title: I am so scared Abby20 kathleen1966

Posts.Content: Aug 6, 2012 06:32AM Abby20 wrote: Dear friends, Just want to let you know that I had good sleep for few nights and today I am meeting the surgeon! The lumpectomy is scheduled Wed. Today I am hoping to know the exact schedule of my treatment (i.e when the chemo will start ...) will keep you posted Wishing you all a nice week :)  Abby
Posts.Title: I am so scared Abby20 kathleen1966

Posts.Content: Aug 9, 2012 04:51PM Abby20 wrote: Lumpectomy went well. I went Tue to the nuclear medicine clinic to get the radioactive tracer - that was very painful- then Wed. morning I had my surgery. The recovery is not bad, I still have prob moving my arm and of course can't carry my baby on my left side where I had the surgery..Can I say I am done with step no. 1 ?? Next is chemo :(
Posts.Title: I am so scared Abby20 kathleen1966

Posts.Content: Abby20 wrote:  Dear friends, I am writing this with tears. Breast cancer nenver cross my mind, specially when I was just enjoying the coming of my first baby who is 7 months now! I am 36 years old so much taken by my career and future plans..A month ago I discovered a small lump on the outter side of my breast, my OB thought it is a cyst but sent me to mamogram, my breast tissue was very dense so they couldn't see anything, I did ultrasoun then biopsy and the result came positive :( Today I discussed with the doc my pathology report and I got to know that  I am HER2+ which is scaring me to death. I want to live only to be there for my baby..I am completely shocked and still find it difficult to comrehend the whole thing..Oh God  Dx 7/20/2012, IDC, 1cm, Stage I, Grade 3, 0/2 nodes, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Surgery 8/8/2012 Lumpectomy: Left; Lymph node removal: Left, Sentinel Targeted Therapy 10/2/2012 Herceptin (trastuzumab) Chemotherapy 10/2/2012 Carboplatin (Paraplatin), Taxotere (docetaxel) Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: I am so scared Abby20 kathleen1966

Posts.Content: Jul 26, 2012 06:01PM Abby20 wrote: Naoko, So sweet of you to keep me in your mind! Take a deep breath, yes tomorrow will be a better day..we have to have a hope what else we can do!! We can't give up I am scheduled for my MRI today and should leave in few minutes, needless to say I AM SO SCARED!!! Today it should shows how far the tumer spread.. and mine is HER2+ Keep me in your prayers please

Posts.Content: Aug 20, 2012 08:58AM Abby20 wrote: Just got the pathology report of my lumpectomy. There is IDC 1.4cm, ER-, PR- and Her2+ which I knew about. I had difficult time accepting the her2+ but then I got to know about Herceptin and felt better. But in the surgery they also found 4mm DCIS, PR+ (5%) ER+ (40%) and Her2- and the surgeon told me the oncologist might decide a hormonal therapy for you :( This was a shock to me and my husband, just last week we've seen a fertility specialist and were planing on embryo freezing. Do you think the oncologist will decide a hormonal therapy for me? I am 36 years old and have a one 8 months old baby. I did the genetic test but don't know the result yet..Can I say no if the oncologist decided to put me on hormone therapy..please let me know your thoughts
Posts.Title: I am so scared Abby20 kathleen1966

Posts.Content: Jul 28, 2012 10:26PM Abby20 wrote: Bdavis, effcancer, misslene, Katkut and Shayne.. Thank you for your support. will try not to think about it this weekend and wait till Monday and see how it goes.  I am struggling now in thinking about what I can do different to make my life healthier, but because I already live a healthy lifestyle  (I have a public health background) I am not able to pinpoint a behavior that needs to be changed  , my husband and I switched to organic food more than 5 years back, our food is mostly fruits and vegetables, we don't smoke, drink occasionally, we exercises and have very active lifestyle! I feel I have lost faith in my field! I am the health advocate at home, I am the one who keep an eye on how environmentally friendly are the detergents we are using at home, I am the one who was lecturing mom and aunts about the importance of screening and early detection of all non communicable diseases...what else I can in my life to make it healthier?
Posts.Title: I am so scared Abby20 kathleen1966

Posts.Content: Jul 29, 2012 06:15AM Abby20 wrote: bdavis, proudtspin, Shayne and DrNoreen, I will keep your words in mind, thank you so much for your advices ( spa was little bit difficult today with the baby!)  DrNoreen, I have noticed the amount of evidence on the importance of the body ph level during pregnancy and I was working to keep my body on the healthy level side. Luckily, I don't drink soda or coffee, but I drink bottled water. So what kind of water do you advice me to drink? Cheers
Posts.Title: I am so scared Abby20 kathleen1966

Posts.Content: Jul 25, 2012 02:04AM Abby20 wrote: Thanks a lot marjie hope you are feeling better by now? I think going through the treatment might be doable since I will always have in mind that it is a phase and it will be over one day, but how can I deal with the fear of recurance and keep going through it again and again? How can I stop worrying about the quality of life I will have in the future with a day in and day out of hospitals, side effects, complications, ..etc. I was hoping to have another baby next year so my boy can have a sibiling and they grow up together, now this becomes a dream thats definitly out of reach

Posts.Content: Jul 24, 2012 06:24PM - edited Jul 24, 2012 06:25PM by Abby20 Thanks for your support and encourging words but even my doc was not happy about my HER2+,  she gave me a booklet which goes over all the complication and side effects of Herceptin ( heart failure, repiratory failure..etc). I don't have further information about my exact prognosis and stage as I still need to do the lumpectomy first and have my lymph node tested. Thanks again ladies I am gathering my strength from your words, I feel I am having long dark days ahead of me but I will try to fight for my loved ones ..pray for me

Posts.Content: Jul 25, 2012 12:01AM Abby20 wrote: Thank you bluepearl thats very helpful. I have a littile of guilt feeling because I had my pregnancy through IVF and one of the tings I read about IVF med side effects that it increase the risk of breast cancer, I told myself well, they have to mention but that doesn't mean I will get it but look what happend now! My baby is the greatest thing in my life, I love him and I don't regret doing the IVF but now I have to pay the price :(

Posts.Content: Apr 11, 2014 05:19AM Abby20 wrote: Dear Chrissy, Can't thank you enough for starting this discussion. I have a general question/ concern. And I think it is very similar to what goes around in the minds of most of us. I had a stage I BC with clear margin and no lymph nodes involvment. My oncologist thought that I don't need PT scan, and i was not so convineced. i finished chemo and radiation April 2013 and recovered quickly. I have no pain or any other symptoms, my energy level is back to normal BUT I still live in fear of the possibility of having  MBC. Does MBC always have symptoms?
